benefits.title: Coenzyme Q10 Benefits Symptoms in Gulf War Veterans: Results of a Randomized Double-Blind Study
benefits.summary: CoQ10 100 mg per day improved physical function and symptoms in veterans with Gulf War illness, except for sleep problems.

benefits.title: Recent Developments in the Role of Coenzyme Q10 for Coronary Heart Disease: a Systematic Review
benefits.summary: CoQ10 supplementation in patients with heart failure improved functional capacity and significantly reduced cardiovascular events and mortality.

benefits.title: Relative Bioavailability of Two Forms of a Novel Water-Soluble Coenzyme Q10
benefits.summary: The novel water-soluble CoQ10 formulations significantly increase absorption and bioavailability, likely due to enhanced water solubility.

benefits.title: Coenzyme Q10 Supplementation in Aging and Disease
benefits.summary: CoQ10 supplementation positively affects mitochondrial deficiency syndrome, aging symptoms, and alleviates cardiovascular disease and inflammation.

benefits.title: Current state of coenzyme Q10 production and its applications
benefits.summary: CoQ10 is beneficial in the treatment of several human diseases when administered orally due to its antioxidant properties.

benefits.title: Coenzyme Q10 Supplementation for the Reduction of Oxidative Stress: Clinical Implications in the Treatment of Chronic Diseases
benefits.summary: CoQ10 supplementation has potential use as a treatment for chronic diseases by reducing oxidative stress and showing beneficial effects in the treatment of chronic diseases.

benefits.title: CoQ₁₀ Function and Role in Heart Failure and Ischemic Heart Disease.
benefits.summary: CoQ10 supplements have potential therapeutic utility in rare cases of primary CoQ10 deficiencies and may have a role in cardiovascular disease, particularly heart failure.

benefits.title: Coenzyme Q10 enhances dermal elastin expression, inhibits IL‐1α production and melanin synthesis in vitro
benefits.summary: CoQ10 treatment promotes fibroblast proliferation, increases type IV collagen expression, and reduces UVR-induced MMP-1 levels, providing anti-ageing benefits.

benefits.title: The Paradox of Coenzyme Q10 in Aging
benefits.summary: CoQ10 supplementation has shown benefits as an anti-aging agent and therapeutic benefits in aging-related disorders, particularly in cardiovascular and metabolic diseases.

benefits.title: Human COQ10A and COQ10B are distinct lipid-binding START domain proteins required for coenzyme Q function[S]
benefits.summary: CoQ10 supplementation has cardioprotective benefits and is associated with multiple human diseases.

side effects.title: Coenzyme Q10 in Heart and Brain Diseases
side effects.summary: Adverse effects like nausea and vomiting may be reduced by using highly bio-available brands that reduce the oral dosage of CoQ10.

side effects.title: Effectiveness of coenzyme Q10 in prophylactic treatment of migraine headache: an open-label, add-on, controlled trial
side effects.summary: CoQ10 might reduce the frequency of headaches, make them shorter in duration, and less severe, with a favorable safety profile.

side effects.title: Coenzyme Q10 alleviates tacrolimus‐induced mitochondrial dysfunction in kidney
side effects.summary: CoQ10 improves tacrolimus-induced mitochondrial dysfunction in kidney, potentially reducing nephrotoxicity.

side effects.title: Efficacy and safety of coenzyme Q10 supplement on simvastatin induced myalgia and transaminase increment
side effects.summary: CoQ10 supplement can reduce myalgia and fatigue occurrence, decrease transaminase and creatine kinase increase caused by simvastatin.

side effects.title: [Investigation of the preventive effect of CoQ10 against the side-effects of anthracycline antineoplastic agents].
side effects.summary: CoQ10 significantly reduced diarrhea and stomatitis in anthracycline-treated patients, but no significant differences were observed in other side effects.
side effects.journal: Gan to kagaku ryoho. Cancer & chemotherapy

side effects.title: Effect of coenzyme Q10 on cutaneous healing in skin-incised mice
side effects.summary: CoQ10 may have an anti-inflammatory and wound healing effect, potentially related to its secondary action.

side effects.title: Coenzyme Q10 Combined With Mild Hypothermia After Cardiac Arrest: A Preliminary Study
side effects.summary: No side effects of CoQ10 were identified in this preliminary study.

side effects.title: Neuroprotective effect of Coenzyme Q10 on ischemic hemisphere in aged mice with mutations in the amyloid precursor protein
side effects.summary: CoQ10 supplementation has a neuroprotective effect on the brain from infarction and atrophy induced by ischemic injury in aged and susceptible transgenic mice.

side effects.title: Effect of Coenzyme Q10 Supplementation in Statin-Treated Obese Rats
side effects.summary: CoQ10 supplementation reduces side effects of statins and has an anti-obesity effect.

side effects.title: T58. EFFECTIVENESS OF ORALLY ADMINISTERED CO-ENZYME Q10 FOR SCHIZOPHRENIA: COGNITIVE, FUNCTIONAL AND BIOCHEMICAL OUTCOMES FROM A DOUBLE BLIND, RANDOMISED, PLACEBO CONTROLLED TRIAL
side effects.summary: CoQ10 supplementation does not ameliorate existing deficits in schizophrenia.

dosage.title: Effect of coenzyme Q10 supplementation on statin-induced myalgias.
dosage.summary: CoQ10 60 mg twice daily did not produce a greater response than placebo in the treatment of presumed statin-induced myalgias.

dosage.title: Effects of Coenzyme Q10 Supplementation on Lipid Profiles in Adults: A Meta-analysis of Randomized Controlled Trials.
dosage.summary: CoQ10 supplementation at a dosage of 400 to 500 mg/day largely reduced total cholesterol in adults.
dosage.journal: The Journal of clinical endocrinology and metabolism

dosage.title: Functions of Coenzyme Q10 Supplementation on Liver Enzymes, Markers of Systemic Inflammation, and Adipokines in Patients Affected by Nonalcoholic Fatty Liver Disease: A Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled, Randomized Clinical Trial
dosage.summary: CoQ10 supplementation at a dosage of 100 mg daily improved systemic inflammation and biochemical variables in patients with NAFLD.
dosage.journal: Journal of the American College of Nutrition

dosage.title: A randomized clinical trial of high-dosage coenzyme Q10 in early Parkinson disease: no evidence of benefit.
dosage.summary: High-dose CoQ10 (1200 mg/d or 2400 mg/d) was well tolerated in this study, but no evidence of benefit was found in slowing disease progression in early Parkinson's disease.

dosage.title: Treatment of essential hypertension with coenzyme Q10.
dosage.summary: The average dose of CoQ10 in this study was 225 mg/day by mouth, adjusted according to clinical response and blood CoQ10 levels.

dosage.title: Partial and complete regression of breast cancer in patients in relation to dosage of coenzyme Q10.
dosage.summary: CoQ10 dosages ranging from 90 to 390 mg were shown to be effective in causing partial and complete regression of breast cancer.

dosage.title: Safety and tolerability of high‐dosage coenzyme Q10 in Huntington's disease and healthy subjects
dosage.summary: CoQ10 dosages range from 1,200 to 3,600 mg/day, with 2,400 mg/day potentially providing the best balance between tolerability and blood level achieved.

dosage.title: Life‐long supplementation with a low dosage of coenzyme Q10 in the rat: Effects on antioxidant status and DNA damage
dosage.summary: Lifelong intake of 0.7 mg/kg/day of CoQ10 enhances plasma levels of CoQQ9, CoQ10, Î2-tocopherol, and retinol, and attenuates age-related declines in total antioxidant capacity and DNA damage.

dosage.title: Progress on therapy of breast cancer with vitamin Q10 and the regression of metastases.
dosage.summary: A daily oral dosage of 390 mg of vitamin Q10 led to complete regression of tumors in three breast cancer patients.

dosage.title: In reply--Coenzyme Q10 and statin-induced myopathy.
dosage.summary: The threshold dosage of CoQ10 supplementation may be greater than 400 mg, explaining why no benefit was seen in this meta-analysis.
